en.title: Digital Maternal and Child Health Platform
en.purpose: Deploy a comprehensive digital platform to improve maternal and child health outcomes through integrated care coordination, real-time monitoring, and evidence-based interventions across the continuum of care.
en.scope:
This use case covers the implementation of an integrated digital maternal and child health platform that:

- Manages pregnancy care from antenatal visits through postnatal follow-up
- Integrates immunization tracking and growth monitoring for children
- Supports community health workers with mobile tools for home visits
- Provides real-time analytics for program monitoring and quality improvement
- Enables patient engagement through mobile health applications
en.actors:
**Primary Healthcare Providers:**
- **Midwives and Nurses** – Provide maternal care and delivery services
- **Pediatricians** – Deliver child health services and preventive care
- **Community Health Workers** – Conduct home visits and health education
- **Program Coordinators** – Oversee MCH program implementation

**Patients and Families:**
- **Pregnant Women** – Primary beneficiaries of maternal health services
- **Mothers and Caregivers** – Recipients of child health services
en.preconditions:
**Infrastructure Requirements:**
- Reliable internet connectivity at health facilities
- Mobile network coverage for community-based services
- Basic computing equipment for healthcare workers
- Established referral networks

**Technical Prerequisites:**
- Functional health information management system
- Integration capabilities with existing systems
- Mobile application development infrastructure
en.process_steps:
**Phase 1: System Design and Development (Months 1-6)**
1. Conduct stakeholder consultations and requirements gathering
2. Design user interfaces for different healthcare worker types
3. Develop core modules for maternal and child health care
4. Create mobile applications for community health workers

**Phase 2: Pilot Implementation (Months 7-12)**
1. Deploy system in selected pilot sites
2. Train healthcare workers on new digital workflows
3. Begin patient enrollment and data collection
4. Monitor system performance and gather feedback
en.postconditions:
**Immediate Outcomes:**
- Comprehensive MCH data collection and reporting
- Improved care coordination between providers
- Enhanced tracking of maternal and child health indicators
- Reduced duplication of services

**Long-term Impact:**
- Improved maternal and child health outcomes
- Evidence-based program planning and resource allocation
- Strengthened health information systems
en.data_requirements:
**Patient Data:**
- Demographics and registration information
- Medical history and risk factors
- Antenatal visit records and screening results
- Immunization records and growth measurements

**Program Data:**
- Healthcare provider information
- Facility capacity and service availability
- Quality indicators and performance metrics
en.technology_components:
**Core Platform:**
- **OpenMRS** configured for maternal and child health workflows
- Custom modules for antenatal care and child health tracking
- Integration with laboratory and imaging systems

**Mobile Applications:**
- Android/iOS apps for community health workers
- Offline data collection capabilities
- SMS integration for patient communication
en.challenges:
**Technical Challenges:**
- Ensuring system reliability under high user loads
- Managing complex data flows between systems
- Implementing robust security for health information

**Implementation Challenges:**
- Training diverse user groups with varying technical skills
- Coordinating with multiple stakeholders
- Ensuring sustainable financing for long-term operation
en.sustainability_considerations:
**Financial Sustainability:**
- Integration with existing health system budgets
- Cost-sharing mechanisms between stakeholders
- Leveraging economies of scale through shared infrastructure

**Technical Sustainability:**
- Building local capacity for system support
- Establishing governance structures
- Planning for regular system updates

fr.title: Plateforme Numérique de Santé Maternelle et Infantile
fr.purpose: Déployer une plateforme numérique complète pour améliorer les résultats de santé maternelle et infantile grâce à la coordination des soins intégrés et au suivi en temps réel.
fr.scope:
Ce cas d'usage couvre la mise en œuvre d'une plateforme numérique intégrée de santé maternelle et infantile qui :

- Gère les soins de grossesse des visites prénatales au suivi postnatal
- Intègre le suivi des vaccinations et la surveillance de la croissance
- Soutient les agents de santé communautaire avec des outils mobiles
fr.actors:
**Prestataires de Soins Primaires :**
- **Sages-femmes et Infirmières** – Fournissent des soins maternels
- **Pédiatres** – Délivrent les services de santé infantile
- **Agents de Santé Communautaire** – Conduisent les visites à domicile
fr.preconditions:
**Exigences d'Infrastructure :**
- Connectivité internet fiable dans les établissements
- Couverture réseau mobile pour les services communautaires
- Équipement informatique de base pour les agents
fr.process_steps:
**Phase 1 : Conception et Développement (Mois 1-6)**
1. Conduire les consultations des parties prenantes
2. Concevoir les interfaces utilisateur
3. Développer les modules principaux
4. Créer des applications mobiles
fr.postconditions:
**Résultats Immédiats :**
- Collecte complète des données SMI
- Coordination améliorée des soins
- Suivi renforcé des indicateurs
- Réduction de la duplication des services
fr.data_requirements:
**Données Patients :**
- Démographie et enregistrement
- Histoire médicale et facteurs de risque
- Dossiers de visites prénatales
- Dossiers de vaccination et mesures de croissance
fr.technology_components:
**Plateforme Principale :**
- **OpenMRS** configuré pour les flux de travail SMI
- Modules personnalisés pour les soins prénataux
- Intégration avec les systèmes de laboratoire
fr.challenges:
**Défis Techniques :**
- Assurer la fiabilité du système
- Gérer les flux de données complexes
- Implémenter une sécurité robuste
fr.sustainability_considerations:
**Durabilité Financière :**
- Intégration avec les budgets existants
- Mécanismes de partage des coûts
- Économies d'échelle par infrastructure partagée

es.title: Plataforma Digital de Salud Materno-Infantil
es.purpose: Implementar una plataforma digital integral para mejorar los resultados de salud materno-infantil a través de coordinación de atención integrada y monitoreo en tiempo real.
es.scope:
Este caso de uso cubre la implementación de una plataforma digital integrada de salud materno-infantil que:

- Gestiona atención del embarazo desde visitas prenatales hasta seguimiento postnatal
- Integra seguimiento de inmunizaciones y monitoreo del crecimiento
- Apoya trabajadores de salud comunitaria con herramientas móviles
es.actors:
**Proveedores de Atención Primaria:**
- **Parteras y Enfermeras** – Proporcionan atención materna
- **Pediatras** – Brindan servicios de salud infantil
- **Trabajadores de Salud Comunitaria** – Realizan visitas domiciliarias
es.preconditions:
**Requisitos de Infraestructura:**
- Conectividad internet confiable en establecimientos
- Cobertura de red móvil para servicios comunitarios
- Equipo informático básico para trabajadores
es.process_steps:
**Fase 1: Diseño y Desarrollo (Meses 1-6)**
1. Realizar consultas con partes interesadas
2. Diseñar interfaces de usuario
3. Desarrollar módulos principales
4. Crear aplicaciones móviles
es.postconditions:
**Resultados Inmediatos:**
- Recolección integral de datos SMI
- Coordinación mejorada de atención
- Seguimiento mejorado de indicadores
- Reducción de duplicación de servicios
es.data_requirements:
**Datos de Pacientes:**
- Demografía y registro
- Historia médica y factores de riesgo
- Registros de visitas prenatales
- Registros de vacunación y medidas de crecimiento
es.technology_components:
**Plataforma Principal:**
- **OpenMRS** configurado para flujos de trabajo SMI
- Módulos personalizados para atención prenatal
- Integración con sistemas de laboratorio
es.challenges:
**Desafíos Técnicos:**
- Asegurar confiabilidad del sistema
- Gestionar flujos de datos complejos
- Implementar seguridad robusta
es.sustainability_considerations:
**Sostenibilidad Financiera:**
- Integración con presupuestos existentes
- Mecanismos de compartición de costos
- Economías de escala por infraestructura compartida
